intro: Rosa mollis var. pseudopomifera, commonly known as the soft rose or the pseudopomifera rose, is a variant of the Rosa mollis species native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy foliage and clusters of fragrant pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and thrives in well-drained soil with partial to full sun exposure. Its botanical features include compound leaves with serrated edges and thornless stems, making it a desirable ornamental plant. This variety is also valued for its potential in horticultural breeding programs due to its unique morphology and adaptability.
